itemDescription: English industrialist, economist, civil servant, statistician, writer, and banker (1880-1941)

wikipedia_page.main: Josiah Charles Stamp, 1st Baron Stamp,  (21 June 1880 – 16 April 1941) was an English industrialist, economist, civil servant, statistician, writer, and banker. He was a director of the Bank of England and chairman of the London, Midland and Scottish Railway.

response: *1941 – Josiah Stamp, 1st Baron Stamp, English economist and civil servant (b. 1880)
*  1880   – Josiah Stamp, 1st Baron Stamp, English economist and civil servant (d. 1941)
